description: From Ancient Greek φάντασμα (phántasma, “ghost”) + ἀγορεύω (agoreúō, “to speak publicly”).

adjectives.description: phantasmagoric (comparative more phantasmagoric, superlative most phantasmagoric)

entries.meaning: Characterized by or pertaining to rapid changes in light intensity and colour.
examples: As early as 1965, however, Tom Wolfe sensed the importance of "electrographic architecture," the phantasmagoric billboards along 79.

entries.meaning: Characterized by or pertaining to a dreamlike blurring of real and imaginary elements.
